text: Folks, looks like I will be in at around 9.
I'll be walking/skiing and should arrive around 10 like normal.
I can't see canada from my house but I can almost see work. Still some snow and ice on the ground. Not many cars on the roads.
will walk in at the normal time
if people are going to drive, I'd suggest at least waiting until it warms up

have seen two dudes fall on their ass on the sidewalk. One was carrying an umbrella that looked like a ray gun and I could only think â€œwhy did you travel back in time to the shittiest day possible to walk around in the past"
"the unfortunate time-traveler"
update: there are cars on burnside and mlk/grand and they seem not to be running into eachother
my lights just flickered. if I lose electricity I'm hiking in to work.
or to the nearest coffee shop.
Bring ski poles!
I snowboard. :disappointed:
also bring something to barter since I assume society has collapsed at this point
I have a basket of beer that I don't plan on drinking
thunderdome is the new law
:laughing:
Iced-in. Don't think i'll be in this morning.
Im at the office the roads are slushy here dont look as icy. MLK was pure ice tho. The bus slid around a bit
that sounds exciting
any time travelers?
Streetcar is currently shut down due to ice on the overhead wires, so I'm staying in for now
staying home! be safe, everyone!
I'm also walking to a coffee shop to work. Maybe I'll come in later if it warms up enough.
walk in was uneventful except for almost getting run over by someone in a rush to pull into an adult video store parking lot

hey all, as we enter the new year, you may find that some harvest projects have changed. let me know if you have any questions, and please make a herculean effort to track your time, as we will have a much higher degree of reliance on good capacity data going forward.
